page.title: 14THE THAMES
page.content: The Thames,once an important trade route,is now a source of pleasure to many.Holiday -makers hire a boat for a week's travel up-stream towards Oxford Pleasure-boats leave regularily for an hour's cruise.Boat-crews practise their rowing eights and tens.Motor boats speed forward leaving turbulent water behind them. By the river on both banks there is parkland, the Brocas on the Eton side and the Home Park on the Windsor side. Here people picnic,play games or paddle in the river. There are several locks along this section of the river. One is Romney lock which stands by Romney Island, an attractive island in the river which separates the wear stream from the lock stream.
